definition: to pull/to draw (a cart or a bow)/to roll up/to coil/to carry on the arm/to lament the dead/(fig.) to pull against/to recover
tool/device/utensil/equipment/instrument/talent/ability/to possess/to have/to provide/to furnish/to state/classifier for devices, coffins, dead bodies

sentences.english: And the harness from our back.
sentences.chinese: 挽具也要搬離我們的背梁。

sentences.english: My father buckled the harness down and went away.
sentences.chinese: 我父親把挽具扣在牲口身上就走了。

sentences.english: Buck threw himself against his harness, and pulled.
sentences.chinese: 巴克用力抵住挽具，拉着。

sentences.english: Then I was tethered to a harness dangling from the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 接著，我被拴在一具從天花板垂下來的挽具上。

sentences.english: "Make ready our sledge, " ordered the Witch, "and use the harness without bells.
sentences.chinese: “備好雪橇，”妖婆命令說，“用沒有鈴擋的挽具。”

sentences.english: It was a sledge, and it was reindeer with bells on their harness.
sentences.chinese: 只見一輛雪橇，有幾隻馴鹿，挽具上掛着鈴鐺。

sentences.english: This shop sells various kinds of saddlery and harnesses.
sentences.chinese: 這家店出售各式各樣的鞍具和挽具。

sentences.english: She stood, checking the clip on her harness. It was tight.
sentences.chinese: 她站著，檢查她挽具上的扣環，太緊了。

definition: to pull a carriage (of draft animal)
